snippet: A new law would waive rescreening requirements for flights from international airports that install baggage scanning processes and equipment similar to those in the United States.
abstract: No-Hassle Flying Act gives Transportation Security Administration authority to waive rescreening requirements for flights from international airports that install baggage scanning processes and equipment similar to those in the United States; legislation is aimed at reducing number of passengers arriving in US who miss connecting flights because their checked bags have to be rescreened.
lead_paragraph: A new law would waive rescreening requirements for flights from international airports that install baggage scanning processes and equipment similar to those in the United States.

headline.main: Law to Simplify Travel for Some Coming From Abroad
